profile.name: BEMELINGUE Wilfried
profile.title: Computer Engineering Student specialized in AI, Deep Learning, and Machine Learning
profile.summary: Currently seeking a 6-month end-of-studies internship in the fields of Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, or Machine Learning. Based in Île-de-France, France. Fully bilingual in French and fluent in English (TOEIC in progress).

experiences.title: Intern – Data Engineer (DataFactory Team)
experiences.description:
Intern in the DataFactory team at COMUTITRES (Île-de-France Mobilités). I architected and migrated legacy ETL data pipelines to Apache Airflow on AWS, significantly improving processing efficiency.

Key achievements:
• Engineered and migrated Python/SQL scripts to Airflow/AWS environment
• Developed automated retry mechanisms using JSON configurations to enhance pipeline reliability
• Designed and deployed KPI dashboards to support Business Intelligence decision-making
• Optimized SQL queries and Python processing scripts
• Strengthened CI/CD pipelines using GitLab for automated deployment

experiences.title: Intern – Logistics Tracking App Development
experiences.description:
Spearheaded the development and migration of a logistics tracking web application for air cargo.

Key achievements:
• Led the database migration from InterSystems Caché to InterSystems IRIS
• Developed a full-stack solution with a JavaScript front-end and ObjectScript/Python back-end
• Designed and integrated REST APIs for real-time air freight tracking
• Administered and configured the InterSystems IRIS server
• Authored comprehensive technical documentation for internal teams and clients

experiences.title: Intern – API Interface Development
experiences.description: Participated in the creation of a web application displaying air freight flows, connected to a REST API. Dynamic data integration using JavaScript, interface readability improvement, functional testing, and contribution to technical documentation.

experiences.title: Intern
experiences.description: Arduino and mechatronics training, creation of a Smart Parking system and a remote-controlled car.

education.degree: Major in Smart Computing for Artificial Graphs (4th and 5th years, final year in progress, CTI accredited)
education.details: The SCIA‑G major trains engineers capable of designing and applying artificial intelligence to graph-structured data. The curriculum includes advanced machine learning, graph neural networks (GNN), explainable AI (XAI), reinforcement learning, medical data processing, MLOps, stochastic modeling, and continuous optimization. Project-based learning through real-world use cases and research challenges is prioritized.

education.degree: Master’s in Computer Engineering (3rd year, CTI accredited)
education.details: In the 3rd year of the engineering cycle, students follow intensive bootcamps, group projects, and simulation challenges designed to strengthen fundamentals and simulate high-pressure professional environments.
Software development and data analysis-oriented training, with hands-on projects.
Introduction to computer systems and web/object-oriented development through technical projects.
Intensive preparation in mathematics, physics and robotics for entrance into an engineering school.

projects.title: Stock Market Forecasting and Risk Management with GNNs
projects.description: Extension of a Differential Graph Transformer (inspired by the Stanford CS224W project) into a predictive multi-task architecture. The model jointly forecasts asset returns and future volatility to drive a risk-aware portfolio allocation strategy. Includes a comprehensive ablation study on graph topologies (local, global, dual) and quantitative backtesting.

projects.title: Black-Scholes Modeling (Quant Finance)
projects.description: Numerical implementation of Stochastic Differential Equations (SDE) for asset pricing with dynamic drift/volatility calibration and Monte Carlo simulations (Euler-Maruyama).

projects.title: Traffic Accident Analysis & Prediction
projects.description: End-to-end Data Science pipeline with K-Means clustering and Random Forest/XGBoost prediction optimized for class imbalance.

projects.title: TinyX Microservices Platform
projects.description: Microservice architecture using Java (Quarkus), MongoDB, Neo4j, Elasticsearch, Redis queues, and Kubernetes.

projects.title: Differentiable Programming Engine
projects.description: Rebuilding a deep learning framework similar to PyTorch to understand automatic differentiation and backpropagation.

projects.title: Galaxy Image Classification
projects.description: CNN trained on Galaxy10‑DECals dataset to evaluate convolutional model performance on astronomical data.

projects.title: CV Screening via NLP

projects.title: Medical AI – 3D Segmentation
projects.description: 3D segmentation of hepatic vessels and tumors on CT volumes. Complete PyTorch/MONAI pipeline including preprocessing, patch-based 3D UNet training, sliding-window inference, and Dice-based evaluation. Comparison with a classical ITK-based segmentation approach.
